pages.text:
PRESENTING
When All The Saints Are Gathered
October 11, 2025 to
October 12, 2025
Set in St. Augustine, Florida, at the height of the Civil Rights Movement, this play follows the journey of five students eager to contribute to the fight for justice. While the national movement is often defined by figures like Dr. Martin Luther King Jr. and Ralph Abernathy, this story focuses on those who were the boots on the ground—leaders like Dr. Robert Hayling, who risked everything for the cause. Through the students’ eyes, we witness their training, their fears, and their triumphs as they prepare for sit-ins, marches, and wade-ins, facing violent backlash at every turn. The play highlights pivotal historical moments, such as the loss of the NAACP charter, the Klan’s attack on Dr. Hayling’s home, and the attempted assassination inside his dental office. The arrival of Dr. King further shifts the movement’s momentum, but the play does not shy away from showing how local leaders like Hayling sacrificed their safety and livelihoods for the movement. Each student, guided by Hayling’s mantra, “Never give up,” takes a different path. Their journey will challenge the audience to examine what it truly means never to give up.

PRESENTING
Ben Sollee - A Black Box Session at Limelight Theatre (Presented by St. Augustine Amphitheatre)
October 21, 2025 to
October 21, 2025
Kentucky musician and composer Ben Sollee has been blurring boundaries with his musical style and career for nearly
two decades – his latest album, Long Haul (2024) is no exception. Drawing on tonal influences from the American and global south, Sollee’s vocals and unique cello style thread through each track binding seemingly disparate chapters of his journey – the Long Haul.  After his last album in 2017, Sollee took a break from touring to grow his family and deepen community connections in Louisville, KY. Now a father of three, Sollee has leaned into his work as a composer; scoring films such as LAND from
director Robin Wright, and Maggie Morre(s), a John Slattery film featuring Tina Fey and Jon Hamm. He also scored t
he
podcast series Unreformed, which was recently nominated for a Peabody Award. Outside of music, Sollee helped launch
the non-profit Canopy, which supports Kentucky businesses positively impacting their communities and planet.

BACK
Support Us
SUPPORT
You can contribute to Limelight!
As St. Augustine’s premier community theater in operation year-round, Limelight Theatre fulfills a mission to serve the community and has done so for 31 years!
As Limelight moves into professional theatre arts, this means higher standards and excellence at all levels. Financial support is crucial to expand accessibility measures, adhere to government regulations, and compensate artists for their contributions to the highest level of storytelling our organization can achieve. We thank you for your generosity and for joining the Limelight family through your giving.
– Mary Claire Branton, Development Director
Our dedicated donors make it possible for us to tell riveting stories, bring captivating characters to life, and explore our world and the times with engaged audiences. Support from individuals and corporate partners is crucial to every season at the Limelight, as well as growing our robust education program. You can direct your gift anywhere you choose.

BACK
About
Our History
Established in 1992, Limelight is the only theatre located in St. Augustine with its own building and year-round programming. In addition to presenting nine mainstage productions each season,
Limelight offers classes and training for all ages, and special events produced by the St. Augustine Film Festival and The St. Augustine Amphitheatre.
Limelight aims to be a nationally acclaimed theatre recognized for artistic innovation and excellence.
Limelight has cultivated a diverse, multigenerational community of artists and supporters through
intriguing storytelling and conservatory training. Our programming educates, engages, and
showcases the importance of the arts and its contributions to society.
Since becoming the Executive Director in 2022, Sherrie Provence has sought to elevate the
Limelight to a professional, regional theatre with a community heart, with the caliber of productions
that make the Limelight Theatre a destination for those traveling to the oldest city. Limelight serves
a growing, loyal patronage of over 20,000 annually and has been votedby
Broadway World
the best
theatre in northeast Florida two years in a row. With more than two hundred volunteers, full
audiences, and popular educational opportunities, Limelight is a thriving center for arts and culture.
Who We Are
Sherrie Provence
Executive Director
Missy Schmotzer
Director of Education
Mary Claire Branton
Development and Marketing Director
